title: Great, friendly service!!
text: We stayed here 2 nights and couldn’t have been more pleased. The staff there was so friendly. One night we needed ice and the front office was closed. The owner saw us and opened the door to let us get ice. That’s great customer service. The rooms are good sizes and they brought us whatever we needed. We will definitely stay here in the future. We had a beautiful view of the woods and it was well manicured. It was close to so many locations, too. We highly recommend to stay here. Especially if you don’t want to pay an arm and a leg. Very reasonably priced. ❤️❤️

title: Nice Rooms
text: A newer hotel in the area. The price was reasonable and comparable to others. Room was very clean, spacious, quiet. The pool water was a like cold, but great for the kids. The only disappointment was the breakfast. There wasn’t much of a choice and what was there didn’t look appetizing. The omelets were over cooked, the apples looked and felt old and the only fruit available, and if you don’t like sausage then you went without a breakfast meat. Also the morning staff smoked in areas that the guests could see. If your not a smoker, your not going to like being forced to walk through. Night staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

title: Great useful app! User friendly!
text:
Been using this app for about 2 years and I’d have to say its seemingly better than the website. Easy to use and always provides to me all the necessary notifications without any of those spam or promo type ones. It keeps track of all your trips and I highly recommend using it. It’s very handy especially during check-in for any of your trips whether car or hotel and adds to your mobile wallet or pass book. No current
Suggestions as I mentioned before, the app provides all necessary information and accessibility for your whole trip.

title: Rooms not guaranteed ...
text: I used this app for the first time this weekend when I needed a last minute room because of a snowstorm delaying my travel.  I found a decent price on an older hotel that was nearby. I gave my credit card and reserved the room - acknowledging that the room was not refundable.  I walked into the lobby about five minutes later to learn that there were no rooms available and that the hotel had been sold out for three days.  I clicked something in the confirmation e-mail to cancel the reservation, and the reply e-mail said there might be a charge for the cancellation!! That’s very surprising since there wasn’t a room available anyway. At this point I don’t think my card has been charged. But I’d be devastated to rely on this app for something like a vacation or necessary travel.  Beware.

title: Hotel Never Got the Booking!!!
text: Don’t use this app if you actually want to book a room. Seriously. I booked a hotel room on a Tuesday night for that Friday. This app took my credit card info (to hold the room) & said I would pay at the hotel but if I didn’t show I would be charged for the room. OK. I received a confirmation email. All was well, so I thought. I arrived at the hotel to check in and they never heard of me! They had NO booking in my name. I even showed the front desk the confirmation email. He said “That’s not from us!” This is a college town. I am so lucky they still had rooms available. If there had been a big event going on... My daughter & I would have been without a room! So, I was given a room & paid for it. Now I’m worried this app is going to charge me for the virtual room that didn’t exist & that I couldn’t show up for. Is this app a scam?

title: Ugh
text:
The outside was being remodeled but there was no walk way past our room and the only thing keeping you from walking was a pallet. 
The inside was very clean. King size bed was ok big fluffy pillows. The sink and toilet were super short and I’m 5’2” and the toilet seat didn’t come to my knees. My husband is 6’ and he had to kneel to brush his teeth because the sink was super short.  The full length mirror he couldn’t even see his face the top of the mirror was mid chest. The deck off back of room needs to be pressure washed was a little slippery.  The inside room was very plain but very clean. Staff was super friendly checking in and out. The maid service was great.

title: Upset lady
text: I am so glad that I booked with this site because I lost my drivers license and didn’t know it until I got to the resort and was trying to register. They told me that they wouldn’t except my military ID, this is what the first person that I talked to told me. I was upset, I am over two hours from home and with 5 of my family members. I went back in and spoke with another person and he suggested that I switch the registration to my son’s name. They told me that other sites would not have let me switch. Still upset that they would not take my military ID. Sand Dunes Resort

title: So awful
text: Get to the hotel and it looks run down. Go inside to check in and the woman is behind a glass window and the small room smells like marijuana enough to get a contact high. There were to ladies in front of me getting rooms they ended up being hookers with their pump outside. We get our key and drive to the back where we find a man peeing by his truck. We start to unload everything and I see two men staring us down from the 3rd floor. We go to our room trying to give the place the benefit of the doubt and our door refuses to open we can only assume it was dead bolted from the inside and at this point decide to leave. We returned our key told them we were checking out and wanted a refund. The women at the desk was rude and told us she already did. We have her our key and left. If you want cheap and wanted to feel unsafe this is the place for you.

title: Wouldn’t stay here again
text: Outside looks amazing. Inside is very basic. Continental breakfast was subpar. The offered fresh made omlettes that costed $3 each. During my reservation, I elected to pay cash on arrival. About 2 hours before my arrival, I called to confirm my reservation and advise them that I would be arriving just before midnight. I again advised that I would be paying cash. It was not until I actually arrived at the hotel did I learn of a $100 dollar required hold on my credit card. This became known after the front desk clerk attempted to charge the total amount of the hotel to my credit card. The room was fairly small. Shower had nice pressure and temperature was very good. Would I stay at this hotel again? Due to the variety of hotels in the area (and I frequent this area often) I would say no.

title: Terrible App
text:
Wanted to beef up my password and add 2FA, but there is nothing in the app. Can’t believe they expect people to plug in credit card info with no options to improve security. Very disappointing!

So today I get a developer response via apple. It says to contact customer support. I follow the info, brings me to web site and zero links to contact support! Only thing is referring back to faq’s. Clicking on need help with something else just goes back to faq’s. Talk about obscuring any type of real support, it’s beyond absurd. 

Eventually I find my acct info on the website and there’s a link to setup 2FA, click on it and it opens a freaking blank page! So back to my account security section and again, nothing to setup 2FA. Frankly, there’s too many other competing apps these days to waste time like this.

title: Wonderful getaway!
text: We came to visit and do some house hunting before we move to the area and the property was great for this! The front desk staff was really sweet and understanding when we kept misplacing our keys or when they wouldn’t work. Housekeeping was great at getting our room back in order while we were out and about, and really kind in helping me figure out the laundry room. The breakfast hostess was so kind and introduced herself always asking how we were doing. Really wish we could have stayed longer! We may have family stay there when they visit so we can all go back! Kids loved the pool too!

title: Don't do it!!
text: Upon arrival we knew we were in trouble right away. We had to wait for someone to arrive at the desk. Then we were told the key machine wasn't working. When we finally got our key we were sent to the back forty which looked like a war zone. People obviously lived there and stayed long term. Around our area was a group of men standing by a truck drinking. Balcony's had plants on them, coolers, tables, etc. We got our stuff in our room, went to dinner. When we came back we couldn't get into our wing. Desk clerk let us in & after a bit brought new keys. The room was just OK.  I believe if you pay more money you get a better wing than we did. We got an inexpensive room off a 3rd party site. But I wouldn't believe most of the reviews

title: Weekend Stay
text:
To start with, entry to the building was awkward. You have to go through 2 doors to get in which is tricky if you have a luggage cart. Once inside, the staff was friendly, although a bit overwhelmed. It was a fully booked weekend and only 1 person behind the counter. 
The room was fair to nice. It was clean. Bed comfortable. But the A/C was loud and kicked on like a truck starting up several times a night. The bathroom fan was also loud and rumbled a bit. But aside from the inconsiderate people who think it’s ok to talk loudly to each other in the hall at 3am, we had a pretty good stay. 
In the end there was a discrepancy in our bill and when I messaged the hotel about it they called me within minutes to work it out. Very Professional.

title: Reviewing the app
text: Most of the app reviews I read were about their hotel stay so I decided to review the app. I have booked a girls’ wknd in Nashville for my 40th early next year. So far I have had to cancel the reservation & rebook once due to a change in the number of people committing. Super easy. I love the fact that you don’t have to pay upfront. That is what caused me to book on this app. There are a lot of variables when you’re planning a trip that includes 7 working moms from all over the Illinois & even one from Michigan, so the ease of cancelation and not having to pay upfront is what led me to the 5 star review. So far so good, Booking app!

title: Neutral with no special feelings at all
text: My wife and I had stayed at Fraser Residence just a few months ago in Kuala Lumpur. That Fraser was much more luxurious in terms of design, cleanliness and comfort. Considering that, we had expected the same level of luxury. However the room gave a sense of being worn out. We asked to be moved and we were and the second room was a little better. But still have a sense of being unused for a while. Breakfast was nice though, lots of options and very pleasant staff. Location was good since we wanted something that isn't too central yet walking distance from the city Centre. Not much more to be said honestly...quite neutral feelings, we left with nothing memorable which is unfortunate considering our experience at KL Fraser

title: Best experience ever
text:
Location of this hostel is the best. I have stayed in many hostels around the world. This one is the best one. 
The price is great. 
The most important experience was that I felt like home. This was because Aisha and Anas went above and beyond. They are very friendly. They made sure I have all the information I need during my stay. Both of them are amazing, friendly, and they are very smart and providing an excellent customer service. They are fluent in English and other languages. 
I will come back there and recommend to staying at this hostel and no need to look anywhere else. 

Some feed backs for improvement since the hostel is new:
Would be better to have curtain for the beds. 
Having several private bed and bath and I think they are working on this. 
Bathrooms can be better. 
Would be great to have a lounge or small area with fridges and some tea or coffees since these people are very friendly.  

Thank you Aisha and Anas.

title: Best memory for ever
text: I recently had an exceptional stay at this hotel. From the moment we arrived, the staff, especially Chery and Pett property Manager, went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. The hotel was perfect,save and large parking lot , clean rooms , looks 4 stars,providing excellent service and assistance throughout our stay. When our car broke down, Chery and Pett  treated us like family, helping us manage the situation and even providing a ride. Their kindness and dedication made our experience truly memorable. I highly recommend this hotel for its outstanding hospitality and caring staff.

title: The most amazing view and location
text: This apartment is  beautifully decorated. The views are the most amazing views you can see from an apartment. Nicoletta is amazing. She is so accommodating always willing to help in anyway she can. Her mom is just as amazing as her. I would definitely stay in this apartment again if I go back to Amalfi,. The location is away from all the crowds, you can take the bus right across the street to anywhere in Amalfi. Did I mention the views! Having breakfast on the extra large terrace makes you not go anywhere. I wish I would’ve stayed longer.

title: Best experience and highly recommended
text:
We are 3 siblings originally from Romania who have moved to California 30 years ago and have not been back since. We also didn’t realize that we booked our trip during Easter weekend, which If you know Romania as a country that is a big deal. This was our first time spending Easter away from our family, and we were treated like we were part of Any’s family. I wish we had planned our trip around staying here longer. HIGLY RECOMMEND, if I could give more stars I would! 

-Extremely clean
-Well kept
-Great view

title: Antusa Palace Hotel
text:
Just as almost all tourist areas in Istanbul, the building is old, which to me, adds a lot of charm, or…was it the staff?  

Uhmmm we fell in love with each one of them, from the day manager Mahmed and ALL his staff to the evening manager Ahmed and ALL  his staff.  I may be getting their names all wrong but you will know once you stay.  Their absolute most professional attitude mixed with a fantastic sense of humor at the most appropriate times made our stay unforgettable.

They were quick to ensure we were confortable, insisted we ask for anything we needed. They arranged for our pick up to and from the airport , they arranged for our Istanbul tour and our Turkish massage, at their spa.  This was also awesome.  Do it at the end of the day, you will be glad you don’t have to drive and you can just go to your room to sleep.
Will come back:  Everything was very clean, rooms, dining room, lobby and spa.  
Downstairs /street restaurant great and great service
Recommend

title: Pictures do not do the place justice
text: What a beautiful place! It was so pretty and clean. We were so comfortable and we did not want to leave. The owners are beyond friendly and very accommodating. If you are a water lover like me, then this is the most perfect place to stay. You have water steps from you room and water walking distances in every direction.  The town is lovely, it gives off such a great vibe.  Next time I go to the Greek islands, I’m going to go straight to Milos since it by far the most beautiful island we have visited so far, and of course stay at the same place.

title: Istanbul Stay
text: This was our second time in Walton Gardens Pera, and we will always go for it when ever going to Istanbul. The hotel is super clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful and make us feel we are really at home. They even take care for the smallest details we never thought they would, they throw a birthday surprised party to my friend as it happened to be while we were there. The location is amazing with short walking distance to anything we would need. Thanks Walton Gardens team for making our stay in Istanbul so great. Thanks for everything.

title: Melita’s PAradise is a warm place to start with young children
text: If you want an authentic experience, a warm hospitable host who will do anything to help you, a nice cozy house with a clean pool and a safe place to hangout in between excursions, then Melita’s Paradise is the place for you. The house is clean, and Melita even left us bread, eggs, water, juice coffee and tea supplies. She even has a hair drier, a curling iron and all other bathroom amenities you might need. No need to fret if you forgot your tooth brush. Perhaps the best part of our stay is that Melita and her husband George make you feel like you are a member of their family. We enjoyed our stay and we will definitely come back!

title: Unexpectedly Impressive
text:
I chose to stay in this hotel only because it was where the rest of the team was staying. I didn’t expect much as it was near the airport. 
I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. Friendly staff, very clean, nice tall ceilings and up to date amenities. There was no noticeable noise from the nearby airport and the bed was quite comfortable. 
The included breakfast was wonderful - had about anything you could think of - eggs, sausages, bacon, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt, etc. Not your typical “continental” breakfast - donuts & coffee.
I would definitely recommend this hotel if you will be passing through - you will not be disappointed!

title: A must have
text: You simply have to check booking dot com when you're searching for lodging. The app is quite good just think the presentation of price should be more forthright on properties that gouge for "special fees." I like the addition of more types of categories and hope to see this app expand to compete with Airbnb since trip advisor which was poised to do that as flip key somehow is useless for finding any affordable accommodation. Booking could get better if they'd really listen to customers like me who have used their app repeatedly. Plus the filters - remember the preferences please. AI and algorithms seem late to this realm of the sharing economy. Need more options for housing always!

title: Disappointed
text:
Upon checking in the front desk employee was sitting in the bar with a new employee. She was training her I believe. I was asked if I had already paid which I showed her my booking once again. Went to room, elevators were extremely small. Opened room it was a king with NO pull out sofa. Which is what I had booked. The room was 75 degrees. We immediately went down and changed rooms. 
New room did not have bedding for pull out sofa, bathroom door would not shut and room would not cool off. 
There was a list of things a mile long of issues. I was disappointed that this was a Wyndham property.

title: Very nice but smelly
text: The apartment was a bit confusing to get into and the host wasn’t very willing to work with me on my arrival time. I arrived and instantly smelled curry. It was very clean so I went to the store got candles, sprays and it still smelled. I thought maybe it was the people before us that had cooked, but when I looked under the sink there were several other candles and sprays from past guests. My clothing etc all smelled when I left. There is also no furniture on the balcony so not very welcoming and hard to enjoy. This apartment could’ve been great just needs some attention.

title: So our room
text:
So our room

Absolutely no place to put a weeks worth of clothes. No dressers or closet 
No hand or face soap at the bathroom sink just body lotion in both dispensers
Dangerous flooring in bath no bath mat. 
The rooms floors are “gritty as there are no mats to wipe your feet upon coming into your unit. 
Great TV however you go to the channel guide everything says “ no show information” time between changing makes you frustrated looking for your channel choices. We gave up and shut it off. 
Feels like a dorm room rather than a vacation type room. Very cold and basic, definitely not home-like and uncomfortable.
No place for us both to just sit and chill maybe snack at a table with the free coffee offered. Either lye down or nothing. 
One chair no couch, yikes. 
Note: went for the “free” breakfast.. eggs were cold and salty, sausage also cold threw out both, grabbed a bagel and butter toasted it took a coffee and went back to our room. Coffee was good, bagel not so much…. 

The room is clean, that said sterile like, cold no comfort or charm no where so just sit. Not at all what we are used to while vacationing to relax and chill. Very very disappointed in this “resort” I dare use that word as it felt as if I was in a dorm room.

title: Scammers
text: This company is a pure scam I paid for a flight realized it was the wrong date tried to cancel not even an hr later which is within the 24hr period. I get the run around saying it has to be refunded through spirit then spirit says it has to be through booking I paid them not spirit. So then I finally get someone on the phone and I’m told it’s nothing they can absolutely due. I call my bank to get the money and booking don’t want to own up this this fraudulent activity they’re using. So I was told I would possible receive a credit. I have no credit for 203 and literally 6 days later after cancellation I receive a cancellation email from them. Which is weird cause I canceled within the 24hr mark and have a screen shot of a time stamp to prove it. I’m done with these greedy people.

title: Total prize!
text: I rate this one five stars because out of 3 hotels book 3 consecutive weekends in search of a comfortable, friendly investment it’s number 1 out the 3 bookings! I rate cleanliness first and far most a 5. I rate comfortability a 5. And affordability also a 5. This hotel is in my opinion an all around winner! This is exactly the what I’ve been searching for in a local hotel. I would highly recommend this one. And for those who have pets, it’s even pet friendly. And to my total surprise it’s well kept being pet friendly. Staff was professional and friendly. 👍🏼👍🏼

title: Hostel not a Hotel
text:
The property is very clean , great location. If you go with the mindset that you are staying in a youth hostel you will be ok. The beds are hard and small . Bathroom downstairs/ down the hall was clean. The “ lobby “ when we arrived was the party room - 4 travelers enjoying the common room ( shared refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave) 
We went out on the town - was a great location...we were in by 10 - tried to get comfortable ( not ideal for 2 large people) just when we fell asleep- people arrived back from the bars - with paper thin walls we heard EVERYTHING! 
We left after one night- we paid for 2 but no refund . Live and learn ...

title: Hidden Hotel Fee
text:
I’ve used this app a few times and I’ve never been charged until I arrived at my hotel because I pay very close attention to when a booking says there’s a prepay needed. However, I got charged for my first night plus other fees so now I’m out $300. 
When I called customer service they said some hotels charge you (yes I know, that’s what I try to avoid, and I already called the hotel and they confirmed I was charged for the first night and fees) and when I told the rep I didn’t show ANYWHERE on the app I’d pay when I reserve the rep TOLD ME NOT TO USE THE APP and to go a book through the website. So yeah. Don’t use the app. Listen to the company. Completely disregard this app and use the website. Forget convenience buy a laptop use the website. Otherwise it’ll cost you $300

title: Amazing Stay
text: This was by far the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed out. The breakfasts were something I found myself looking forward to each and every morning. The pool was refreshing and in perfect view of the harbour and sunset.I really liked how quiet and comfortable the hotel was but Most if all how Kind and accommodating Paula and Thomas were during our stay. I felt at home away from home. I cannot thank you both enough. Luiz and I will be visiting you both again in the future. Thank you for the memorable stay and God bless you and your family.

title: Don't understand why you are charged a cancellation fee know you didn't do it before
text: I got a room reservation and then went to this motel and I would not let my dog stay in that place the picture that was taken looked pretty good then got to the motel and I think it was a crack motel it was scary and dangerous so I just pulled away it said it had a pool but the pool was closed I'm sorry for this bad review but u need to investigate before u put something on your site cause I am four or so hours from home and didn't have a place to stay after seeing this motel had to find something else God Bless have a great day

title: A nice surprise
text: With my last booking this app went from being a great tool to an enjoyable experience. Two reasons: 1. The place I ultimately booked after researching EVERYWHERE else was the first one the app suggested (and was the best value after all the enticing per-night rates got totally eclipsed by exorbitant deposits and cleaning fees). 2. THEN, as I was checking out, I was offered an enticing upgrade: a better room for just $11 more. What? Better than this? They offered an upgrade to a double queen (which I had passed up for that sweet single king for $11 less). (see #1). But I really appreciated that ‘are you sure?’ moment.

title: Waste of time
text: Do not book here! We arrived Friday afternoon to check in number one they are doing construction so the lobby is closed & it’s very noisy from the work being done once we got to the area to check in we were told by the front desk clerk that their system was down & she could not check us in we started to ask questions she got an attitude & also advised us there was no time frame as to when it would be back up also while in the “lobby” there was a typed up paper stating they shut the water off during a certain Time of the day due to water pipe issues. This was a big inconvenience after driving for nearly 4 hours to get here to have to experience this. It would be nice to let people know that the property is under construction at this time

title: Don’t recommend !
text:
Bathrooms are extremely small. Fan is very noisy ! 
Stayed three days(booked ahead), had No maid service the entire stay! Ran out of towels & TP. You can open & close the door while sitting on the toilet !
Room was not ready when we arrived ( we were 15 minuets early before check in but waited even longer than that.
Saw a cleaning lady going from room to room of people that left, using the same bucket of dirty water in each room. 
They are painting the outside, so a lot of the windows were covered in plastic. They should update the inside first before doing the outside. You can not charge your phone( the outlets were on the side of headboard which was somewhat recessed into the wall with less than a inch to plug anything in & forget using a cube! You could use the plug by the desk if you left the light on but it’s on a timer & goes out after about 10 min.
Mattress & pillows were awful. Breakfast was not good & people were eating in their pj’s. One friendly staff was at check in other than tha we didnt see many . There was a girl at the desk on our last night. That was very rude when we asked her a question.
Do yourself & find somewhere else!

title: Not what I expected
text: I have been using booking for sometime now. But for the past couple of bookings I have had issues with the price they reflect with hotels and car rentals. There is a big discrepancy with the price when you get to the hotel or get the car. The app price is attractively low but the true price is upsettingly much higher aside from resort fee, parking, taxes, etc. Unfortunately, cancelling through the hotel and booking is difficult. They seem to be pinpointing at each other. I ended up not getting even a little of refund. I never did learn my lesson. Since the app is easy to use, I booked again and unfortunately, had the same experience. For me, go straight to the hotel website and inquire rather than using this app. Anyway, this is part of priceline.

title: Awful customer service
text: The customer service is the worst I’ve ever experienced. I found really good flights to Dubai, first class and right as I was about to checkout the price tripled!!! I went back and reselected the same flights and the same thing happened again, so I took a picture and contacted customer service via email. After three days of back and forth and I sent them the picture, they just blew me off! They did absolutely nothing to assist or even try to figure out what happened. I even explained that I was trying to purchase tickets so me and my family could visit my aunt who has been stuck since the start of the pandemic. And they just blew me off again. I say, if you want to feel valued and you want a company who will honor their prices then go to EXPEDIA.

title: best bang for your buck!
text: soaking tub! Comfy bed, easy access to Starbucks coffee & restaurants literally a few steps away… do yourself a favor & just stay here!! they even have a pool & jacuzzi!! They put on an unexpected breakfast with waffles & scrambled eggs which in my humble opinion adds that extra something you want from a hotel stay… friendly staff, easy check in! Even the maintenance guy was very nice… he was checking the chlorine in the jacuzzi & pool staying busy. Just got an overall good feeling about this hotel & at a price point that doesn’t hurt the wallet. Thank you Fairbridge!!

title: Do Not Use This App/Company
text:
As soon as you have a problem with your reservation you will be transferred to a call center located in Amsterdam, my experience was talking with some young lady that kept talking without letting me speak, refused to let me speak with her supervisor/manager and repeated the same sentence: you do not have security clearance, I don’t know what that’s even mean, I gave her all the information she requested, and I just called to make complaint on a experience we had. 
In the end she tried claiming it’s not them but Priceline, and insisted that I speak with them, I requested that she will stay on the line, she approved and when she said wait I’m connecting them, she disconnected the call!
Do the reservation directly with the airline or hotel, those 3rd party companies are destroying the experience and you can’t complain if you have an issue.

title: Home2Suite Pigeon Forge - Amazing trip
text: Besides the fact that the trip was amazing, the hotel was amazing too. Very family friendly and pet friendly. Breakfast was much better than expected. You can make your own waffles, toast bagels, have around the clock fresh coffee, cereal, oatmeal, and muffins available too. The rooms are super clean and very modern. The hotel is right across from the Island. Less than a mile from all the shops and local restaurants. Best part you can find a hiking trial less than 10-15 mins drive away. Definitely will come back and stay here.

title: Good but SUGGESTIONS:
text:
1.  Offer an “app feedback” link in the app or mobile website.  Can’t find it- so posting here

2.  Change list of current bookings AND past bookings to be either “most recent” booking first, or selectable sort order (currently its oldest shown first for current bookings and sorted by “trip” (group of bookings in one  area) newest first but then oldest booking within that trip. Doesn’t make sense.  I always want to see my most recent first if I go to these lists. 

3.  Good job showing fees included more often now. - always keep up with price transparency and show total price in the searches!!!!

title: Big disapointment
text:
I came back to this hotel because I liked it the first time but it was a big disappointment this time.
They gave me the room Joachin, next to the kitchen, it was very noisy until the kitchen closed and the room was infested with mosquitoes.
The following day I asked to change and even before I said it, they acknowledged that it was a noisy room, how can they rent a room which is not suitable!!!
The following night I was in the 3rd floor room which is nice and silent.
As I was staying one more night I left my things in the bathroom and my shampoo strangely disappeared after the room was cleaned. I asked the receptionist to ask the cleaning where she put it, the answer was she did not remember a shampoo.
Finally I had to pay the staying tax for 2 although I was the only occupant of the room.
All these details added made my stay very disappointing.
It is an expensive hotel and there shouldn’t be any trust issues with the staff.
I won’t go back and I won’t recommend it.

title: Good place, but noisy
text:
Room was nice, comfy bed, good central heating, shower was good as well. From the safety point of view the place was secure, no issues. The location was well located, 2 blocks from Stazione Centrale and subway. The only problem was that it was noisy. 
Two or three times a week at 6:30 am they take the trash out through the main entrance where my room was. Then while I was there workers were working on other rooms so there was a lot of loud talking on the hall and hammering. Last but not least, the walls are very thin and you can hear everything from the other rooms. 
So yes, I liked it, but not the best place for sleeping

title: The perfect stay in Old Town Dubrovnik!
text: The location of this apartment is just perfect. Nestled in old town, right next to the city wall, this is a beautiful and clean apartment with all of the amenities you’ll need for a comfortable short or long term visit to Dubrovnik. VERY large one bedroom home, clean, tidy, great working air conditioner, working washing machine. The owner was very kind and offered to book excursions, he even came late at night when the washing machine broke to fix it! I especially loved the cats that would come by to relax on the patio. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Formula One trip experience
text:
First I should say the place as such was lovely. The room comfortable and we were provided unlimited water, nuts, biscuits and apples.
The place is 15 minutes to the circuit, but of course once you get to your parking spot at the circuit is quite a walk until you get to your seats due to the amount of people and security checks.
The breakfast was delicious, with various options and I particularly loved the scrambled eggs with bacon and the fresh fruits available daily. My son liked the variety of cereals and juices.
Chris was an amazing host. Not only he gave us a lot of tips but helped us in many ways. Among others, he gave us very good quality ponchos that we used every day (it rained on and off every day), there were umbrellas and our room had binoculars that we enjoyed.
We liked the air conditioned room and spacious bathroom.
I highly recommend this hotel and it enhanced our FormulaOne experience.

title: Satisfied
text:
I would say the beds were really quite comfortable-which from a stay perspective is my #1 priority. The room was clean and we had fresh towels daily. 

The pool was average-nothing special but enough to keep our kids happy. There is no hot tub although it appeared like there used to be one. 

The breakfast was what we expected from a hotel like this-eggs, cereal, yogurt, bagels, waffles daily and sausage links or patties depending on the day. There were many options for restaurants and gas nearby. There are also shopping malls and movie theaters close.

The only complaint was that the hallway by our room smelled musty-almost like there was mold. Not sure if it was the ice machine, the vents or something else. The hallway appeared clean-but the smell was a bit much. 

The rooms smelled fine so I could tolerate the few minute spent in the hallway and the AC worked phenomenal -especially since it was so hot during our stay. I would stay here again….but I also would be willing try new spots for a nicer pool.

title: Park Meadows
text: It was a decent place. The only issue I had was that I booked a queen room & when I arrived they had no queen availability then put me in a king room. When I went to check in for the next reservation I made after deciding to stay the rest of the week I had to pay them money for the difference of a queen to a king even though no queen rooms were available. I was told if I didn’t pay the difference I would have to leave regardless if I had a new reservation being non refundable. I think that was a really unfair because you checked me into a king I did not ask for it. Because they over booked on the queen I am looked to pay the difference of something I didn’t ask for or was In my control

title: Incredibly terrible website and app
text: I had such a big headache with this company. The inconvenience they caused me and had one sad solution to it, after following up with the steps they provided me as a solution I got no response and no help from the supervisor and the manager. They cancelled a reservation I paid for in advance while I was at the hotel to check in. Then tried to get me to make another reservation to pay even more money!!!! Not only did my refund take 7-12 business days to be refunded. But I had to pay double just to be able to rest after a long drive in. This company is terrible and the customer service is even worse. Do not use them. They are not worth the trouble and headache. Save your time, save your money, and save the trouble and headache.
